main event: A green, swiftly moving, elliptical light with a longish tail was observed orbiting counter-clockwise in a circular course over Southern Pines, North Carolina in 1951.
interesting points: The object's speed was variable but always very fast.
The object was best observed in the left to right arc, and was less frequently seen in the far arc.
The object stopped, appeared elliptical without the tail, and then resumed motion instantly.
The observer was a reliable civil service civilian employee.
The object's color was described as a soft green light rather than brilliant.
sighted object: green, elliptical light with a longish tail
